intro: Selinum collinum, commonly known as mountain parsley, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small white or yellowish flowers that bloom in umbels. The plant is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often growing in rocky or calcareous soils. It has a tall, slender stem and is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value. Selinum collinum is also used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
